newsitem.title: USA: Motorola files patent infringement suit.
newsitem.headline: Motorola files patent infringement suit.

text.p: Motorola Inc said Tuesday it filed a patent infringement lawsuit in federal District Court for the Northern District of Illinois against Qualcomm Inc and Shieldmate Robotics.
Last week, Motorola said it intended to file the suit against Qualcomm, alleging that its "Q" phone copies the design of Motorola's handheld StarTAC digital cellular phone.
Motorola, which filed the suit on Monday, said it is seeking a preliminary injunction to stop all of Qualcomm's and Shieldmate's activities with respect to the Q phone.
A hearing date was set for March 28.

Motorola said Shieldmate is a long-time supplier of cellular telephone housings and shielding to Motorola's Cellular Subscriber Sector and is the principal supplier of Motorola's StarTAC phone housings.

Motorola claimed that Shieldmate received detailed engineered drawings of the StarTAC phone housing, subject to a non-disclosure agreement, and worked on the design and creation of molding tools used to make StarTAC phone housing components.
Motorola said its lawsuit alleges, in part, that Shieldmate breached the non-disclosure agreements.
Claims against Qualcomm include infringement, unfair competition, dilution of Motorola's trademarks and deceptive trade practices.
